title: 111_s3917
content:
The Act is titled the "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines terms such as distribution fixture land, District, and Electric Distribution System. The curr_chunk defines terms related to power distribution systems on Federal land, including fixtures and irrigation or power facilities land. The curr_chunk defines terms related to power distribution systems on Federal land, including fixtures and irrigation or power facilities land. The terms include "Secretary" referring to the Secretary of the Interior and "shared power pole" which are poles supporting fixtures in the Strawberry Valley Project Power Transmission System. The curr_chunk states the conveyance of the electric distribution system. The curr_chunk discusses the conveyance of the Electric Distribution System from the Strawberry Water Users Association to the District, including the transfer of fixtures and distribution fixture land. The curr_chunk discusses the license for use and access for operation, maintenance, and replacement of fixtures on project land necessary for other Strawberry Valley Project facilities. Before conveying land, interests, and fixtures, the Secretary must comply with environmental laws such as the National Environmental Policy Act and the Endangered Species Act. This Act does not change any existing obligations under environmental laws. The Secretary must comply with environmental laws such as the National Environmental Policy Act and the Endangered Species Act before conveying land, interests, and fixtures. Upon conveyance of land or facilities under section 3(a)(1), they will no longer be part of a Federal reclamation project. The District will not receive future Bureau or Reclamation benefits for the conveyed land and facilities, except for benefits available to other non-Bureau of Reclamation facilities. The United States will not be liable for damages related to the land and facilities post-conveyance, except for damages caused by acts of negligence prior to the conveyance date. SEC. 5. REPORT.

If conveyance under section 3(a) is not completed within 2 years of enactment, the Secretary must report to Congress on the status, obstacles, and anticipated completion date.
